confirm_delete_description: This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete the notifier "{{name}}" and remove it from all monitors that use it.

empty_state.description: Get started by creating your first notification channel to send alerts to your team.
empty_state.title: No notification channels found

discord.bot_display_name_description: The name that will appear as the sender of the Discord messages.
discord.custom_message_prefix_description: Optional prefix that will be added to the beginning of all messages.
discord.custom_message_prefix_placeholder: Optional: Add a prefix to your message
discord.forum_post_name_description: The name of the new forum post that will be created.
discord.sending_message_to_description: Choose where to send Discord messages.
discord.setup_webhook_description_1: Get your webhook URL from Discord server settings → Integrations → Webhooks.
discord.setup_webhook_description_2: Create a new webhook and copy the URL. Make sure you selected the correct channel.
discord.thread_id_description_1: Enable Developer Mode in Discord User Settings → Advanced → Developer Mode
discord.thread_id_description_2: Right-click on the thread or post and select "Copy Thread ID" or "Copy Channel ID"
discord.thread_id_description_title: The ID of the thread or forum post where messages will be sent

gotify.application_token_description: The application token from your Gotify application. You can find this in your Gotify web interface under Apps.
gotify.custom_message_description_2: Leave empty to use the default message.
gotify.custom_title_description: Custom title for the notification. Available variables: {{ msg }}, {{ monitor.name }}, {{ status }}, {{ heartbeat.* }}. Leave empty to use the default "Vigi" title.
gotify.learn_more_label: Learn more about Gotify and how to set it up at:
gotify.note_description: You need to have a Gotify server running to use this integration.
gotify.priority_description: Message priority (0-10). Higher numbers represent higher priority. Default is 8.
gotify.server_url_description: The URL of your Gotify server. Make sure it's accessible from this application.

grafana_oncall.grafana_oncall_url_description: The webhook URL from your Grafana OnCall integration. You can find this in your Grafana OnCall instance under Alerts & IRM > IRM > Integrations > Webhook.
grafana_oncall.learn_more_label: Learn more about Grafana OnCall webhooks

line.channel_access_token_description: You can get your channel access token from the
line.channel_access_token_description_2: Navigate to your channel settings and look for
line.channel_access_token_placeholder: Enter your LINE channel access token
line.template_description: Customize the message format. Available variables
line.user_id_description: You can find your User ID in the
line.user_id_description_2: Navigate to your channel settings and look for

matrix.access_token_description: Your Matrix access token for authentication
matrix.homeserver_url_description: The URL of your Matrix homeserver
matrix.internal_room_id_description: The internal room ID where notifications will be sent. This should start with "!" and look like: !roomid:matrix.org
matrix.setup_instructions_1: Create a Matrix account for your bot (or use your existing account)
matrix.setup_instructions_2: Create or join the room where you want to receive notifications
matrix.setup_instructions_3: Get your access token by making a login request
matrix.setup_instructions_4: The response will contain an access_token field - use this as your Access Token
matrix.setup_instructions_5: Find your room's internal ID (starts with "!") in your Matrix client room settings

mattermost.channel_name_description: The channel where notifications will be sent. Leave empty to use the default channel configured in the webhook.
mattermost.icon_emoji_description: Emoji to use as the icon. You can specify two emojis separated by a space (first for up status, second for down status).
mattermost.icon_url_description: URL of an image to use as the icon for the notification message.
mattermost.message_template_description: Customize the message format. Available variables
mattermost.use_message_template_description: Enable to use a custom message template and format.
mattermost.username_description: The username that will appear as the sender of the message.

ntfy.authentication_type_basic_description: Use username and password for basic authentication.
ntfy.authentication_type_none_description: No authentication required. Suitable for public NTFY servers.
ntfy.authentication_type_token_description: Use an access token for authentication.
ntfy.password_required: Password is required for basic authentication
ntfy.priority_description: The priority level of the notification. Higher priorities may trigger different behaviors on the client.
ntfy.server_url_description: The URL of your NTFY server. Use https://ntfy.sh for the public instance.
ntfy.tags_description: Comma-separated tags for categorizing notifications. Available variables
ntfy.title_description: Custom title for the notification. Available variables
ntfy.token_description: Your NTFY access token for authentication.
ntfy.token_required: Token is required for token authentication
ntfy.topic_description: The topic name for your notifications. This will be the channel where notifications are sent.
ntfy.username_required: Username is required for basic authentication

opsgenie.priority_description: Set the priority level for alerts. Default is P3 (Moderate).
opsgenie.region_description: Choose your Opsgenie region. This determines which API endpoint will be used.

pagerduty.auto_resolve_description: Choose what action to take when a monitor comes back up
pagerduty.auto_resolve_do_nothing_description: No action taken on UP status
pagerduty.integration_key_description: Learn how to get your integration key
pagerduty.integration_url_description: The PagerDuty Events API v2 endpoint URL. Defaults to the standard endpoint.
pagerduty.priority_description: The severity level for PagerDuty incidents. Defaults to "warning".

pagertree.authentication_token_description: Optional authentication token for enhanced security. This will be sent in the pagertree-token header.
pagertree.auto_resolve_alerts_description: Automatically resolve PagerTree alerts when the monitor recovers
pagertree.integration_url_description: Enter your PagerTree webhook integration URL.
pagertree.urgency_level_description: Set the default urgency level for alerts sent to PagerTree

pushbullet.access_token_description: Your Pushbullet Access Token. Get it from
pushbullet.channel_tag_description: Send notification to a Pushbullet channel instead of devices
pushbullet.custom_message_template_description: Customize the notification body using template variables:
pushbullet.device_id_description: Send notification to a specific device. Leave empty to send to all devices. You can find device IDs using the

pushover.device_description: Leave blank to send to all devices
pushover.message_title_description: Leave blank to use default title
pushover.more_info_label_2: You can create an application and get your API token at
pushover.more_info_label_3: Your user key can be found at
pushover.notification_sound_down_description: Sound for when monitor goes down
pushover.notification_sound_up_description: Sound for when monitor comes back up

signal.important_description: You cannot mix groups and numbers in recipients!
signal.more_info_label: You can check this URL to view how to set one up:
signal.note_description: You need to have a Signal client with REST API.
signal.number_description: The phone number of your Signal account (sender number).
signal.post_url_description: The URL of your Signal CLI REST API server.
signal.recipients_description: Comma-separated list of phone numbers to send notifications to.

slack.channel_name_description: The channel where the message will be sent. If not specified, the message will be sent to the default channel configured in the webhook.
slack.channel_name_description_2: You can override the default channel by specifying a channel name (e.g., #alerts) or a user (e.g., @username).
slack.channel_notify_description: When enabled, the message will trigger notifications for all channel members. Use with caution to avoid spam.
slack.icon_emoji_description: Emoji to use as the icon for this message. Must be in the format :emoji_name:
slack.message_format_description_2: Enable to send messages with rich formatting, attachments, and better visual presentation.
slack.username_description: The username that will appear as the sender of the message. If not specified, the default bot name will be used.
slack.webhook_url_description: The webhook URL from your Slack integration. You can find this in your Slack instance under Integrations > Webhooks.

smtp.custom_description: Templatability is achieved via the Liquid templating language.
smtp.custom_description_2: Please refer to the documentation for usage instructions.
smtp.smtp_host_description: Either enter the hostname of the server you want to connect to or localhost if you intend to use a locally configured mail transfer agent

telegram.chat_id_description: You can get your chat ID by sending a message to your bot and clicking "Auto Get" above, or manually via the Telegram API.
telegram.chat_id_not_found: Chat ID not found in the latest update.
telegram.message_thread_id_description: Optional. Used for sending messages to a specific thread (topic) in a forum supergroup.
telegram.no_updates_found: No updates found. Please send a message to your bot first.
telegram.protect_content_description: If enabled, the message content will be protected from forwarding and saving.
telegram.send_silently_description: If enabled, messages will be sent silently (users will receive a notification with no sound).
telegram.server_url_description_2: You can use a custom server. See
telegram.template_description: Customize the message format. Available variables
telegram.template_parse_mode_description: Choose how the message should be parsed. See
telegram.use_template_description: Enable to use a custom message template and format.

webhook.additional_headers_description: Add custom HTTP headers to the webhook request.
webhook.custom_body_description: Customize the request body format. Available variables
webhook.post_url_description: The webhook endpoint URL where notifications will be sent.
webhook.request_body_description_custom: Define your own custom request body format below.
webhook.request_body_description_form_data: Content will be sent as multipart/form-data. You can decode it using json_decode($_POST['data']) in PHP.
webhook.request_body_description_json: Content will be sent as JSON with "application/json" header.
